DataElement.preferredName: Person Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A class of traumatic stress disorders with symptoms that last more than one month. There are various forms of post-traumatic stress disorder, depending on the time of onset and the duration of these stress symptoms. In the acute form, the duration of the symptoms is between 1 to 3 months. In the chronic form, symptoms last more than 3 months. With delayed onset, symptoms develop more than 6 months after the traumatic event._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._A class of traumatic stress disorders with symptoms that last more than one month. There are various forms of post-traumatic stress disorder, depending on the time of onset and the duration of these stress symptoms. In the acute form, the duration of the symptoms is between 1 to 3 months. In the chronic form, symptoms last more than 3 months. With delayed onset, symptoms develop more than 6 months after the traumatic event.

Property.preferredDefinition: A class of traumatic stress disorders with symptoms that last more than one month. There are various forms of post-traumatic stress disorder, depending on the time of onset and the duration of these stress symptoms. In the acute form, the duration of the symptoms is between 1 to 3 months. In the chronic form, symptoms last more than 3 months. With delayed onset, symptoms develop more than 6 months after the traumatic event.

Concepts.definition: An anxiety disorder precipitated by an experience of intense fear or horror while exposed to a traumatic (especially life-threatening) event. The disorder is characterized by intrusive recurring thoughts or images of the traumatic event; avoidance of anything associated with the event; a state of hyperarousal and diminished emotional responsiveness. These symptoms are present for at least one month and the disorder is usually long-term.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: A questionnaire to assess pos
ReferenceDocuments.description: A questionnaire to assess post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), an anxiety disorder characterized by reliving a terrifying event and avoiding associated situations. Traumatic events that may trigger post traumatic stress disorder include circumstances where physical harm occurred or was threatened such as violent personal assaults, natural or human-caused disasters, accidents, or military combat

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
